data.name: Good Times With Zones
data.description:
We have a timezone offset expressed in a nice regular uniform string. Let's format that in bizarre new ways!

Source Format `{sign}{hours}:{minutes}`
- sign: Either `+` or `-`
- hours: Hour component. Two digits. Leading zeros.
- minutes: Minute component. Two digits. Leading zeros.

Target Format `UTC{sign}{hours}{separator}{minutes}`
- sign: Either `+` or `-`
- hours: Hour component. 1/2 digits. No leading zeros.
- separator: Value is always `H`. Only present if there is a corresponding minute component.
- minutes: Minute component. 1/2 digits. No leading zeros. Only present if greater than zero.

Examples:
- `+00:00` => `UTC+0`
- `-00:00` => `UTC+0`
- `+01:00` => `UTC+1`
- `-01:00` => `UTC-1`
- `+05:45` => `UTC+5H45`
- `-02:30` => `UTC-2H30`

Points of Interest
- There is no timezone on earth with a single-digit minute offset. i.e. there is no `+00:07`. But we're gonna test for that anyway. Just in case they invent it.
- The source format is derived from moment-timezones [here](https://momentjs.com/timezone/docs/#/using-timezones/converting-to-zone/). The target format is custom made for some wacky Willy Wonka machine.
